content:
Diagnosis:	Ascending colon adenocarcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Right hemicolectomy

Histology:	pT3N0M0 conventional adenocarcinoma, MMR proficient, PIK3CA H1047R mutation detected

Current Situation:	Post-operative surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in the colorectal oncology clinic today. She has made an excellent recovery following her right hemicolectomy in January. Her wound has healed well and bowel function has normalized. She reports good energy levels and has returned to her usual activities. Her weight is stable at 68kg.

Her latest CT scan from 15/4/24 shows no evidence of recurrent disease. Blood tests including CEA are within normal range. Given her stage IIA disease with high-risk features (T3, MMR proficient status), we have discussed surveillance plans. She will continue with 3-monthly CEA measurements and 6-monthly CT scans for the first two years.

Plan is to review her again in 3 months with repeat CEA measurement. CT scan will be arranged for October 2024.
